title: Which are some famous songs with the same lyrics but different music? - Quora

response.answer_text: Hotel California.original track by Eagles has more than 20 covers versions.(my favorite is by EAGLES(unplugged).Knockin' on Heaven's Door.has more than 15 cover versions.(my favorite by GUNS N ROSES and AVRIL LAVIGNE)Soldier of Fortune (song).has more than 5 cover versions. (my favorite is by OPETH).Another Brick in the Wall.also has more than 5 cover versions.(my faorite is by KORN).Turn the Page (Bob Seger song).it also has more than 5 cover versions.(my favorite is by METALLICA).Stairway to Heaven.a very famous song from 70's. which has more than 15 covers.(my favorite by LED ZEPPELIN (original track) and a live cover by HEART).When the Levee Breaks.has only two versions one by BLUES and another by LED ZEPPELIN, both of them are too good.

From another angle: many classical composers composed settings for the Catholic liturgy -- the most famous one I can think of is that Mozart's Requiem and Faure's Requiem have the same words in many movements (to name just two of many requiems).  Generally, any classical pieces (usually movements) that share the name Kyrie or Gloria or Te Deum (etc.) have the same words. This question got a lot more interesting in the late 20th century  (or maybe it's just in pop) -- it used to be a lot more  common  to find a text and write music to it, rather than creating new words every time.
